Name: Japanese Pear
Ingredients: 10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
1 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Garnish with pear wedge on rim.
Review: Originally made with Poire William liqueur, hence this version calls for a little sugar. We've also taken the liberty of adding a dash of Creole-style bitters for added complexity and the merest salmon-pink tint of colour.
History: Adapted in 2002 from a recipe originating at Grand Pacific Blue Room in Sydney, Australia.
Nutrition: One serving of Japanese Pear contains 212 calories
